ext_descriptions:
A blend_end_condition is a select type used to specify the termination conditions when blending a continuous path of edges in a solid. type of end condition required when blending a .
A blend_radius_variation is an enumeration of the types of function controlling the variation of radius when blending a continuous path of edges in a solid.
the blend radius varies linearly between radius definition points.
the blend radius varies as a cubic function between radius definition points.
the blend radius variation function is not specified.
A solid_with_placed_feature is a select type used to specify the type of placed feature which may be used to create a pattern.
A sculpting_surface is a select type used to specify the type of surface used to cut a solid model to create a smaller solid.
A Solid_with_edge_modification is a type of
that specifies the edges to be modified and the type of modification required. The subtypes of this entity define in detail the types of possible edge modification. A Solid_with_edge_modification may be a
or one of a , a , a , a .
the list of edges to be modified.
A Path_modified_solid is a type of
in which the edges to be modified form a continuous path. This entity is incompletely modelled in the ARM, the corresponding MIM entity contains a constraint to ensure that the specified edges have the correct configuration.
A Path_modified_solid_with_end_conditions is a type of
for which the blend is terminated at points other than the start and end vertices of the path of selected edges. This entity is incompletely modelled in the ARM, the corresponding MIM entity defines the types of termination condition permitted and contains constraints to ensure consistency.
the list of two end_conditions which define respectively the start and end of the edge blending process.
A Solid_with_fixed_radius_edge_blend is a type of
in which the modified edges are blended in the form of a rolling ball blend of constant radius.
the radius of the rounded edges created by the blending process.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_variable_radius_edge_blend is a type of
in which the modified edges are blended in the form of a rolling ball blend whose radius varies as it traverses the path of edges.
the points along the path of edges at which the radius values are specified.
the assigned values of the radius at the .
the types of interpolation function to be used to control the blend radius at intermediate points along the path of edges.
The number of
shall be equal to the number of .
The number of
shall be one less than the number of .
A shall not be instantiated as a complex subtype with one of the specified subtypes of .
A Solid_with_simple_chamfer is a type of
in which the modified edges are chamfered connecting points at equal distances from the modified edge on adjacent faces. Offset curves are defined on the two faces adjoining the edge concerned, at equal distances from the edge; a ruled surface is constructed between the offset curves, and is used as the underlying surface of the new chamfer face.
the distance from the modified edge to the end of the chafer on the adjacent faces.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_double_offset_chamfer is a type of
in which the modified edges are chamfered connecting points at different distances from the modified edge on adjacent faces.
the distance from the modified edge to the end of the chafer on face to the left of the edge.
the distance from the modified edge to the end of the chafer on face to the right of the edge.
The shall be positive.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_angled_chamfer is a type of
in which the chamfers are defined in terms of an offset curve on one of the faces adjoining at the edge concerned and an offset angle measured with respect to the surface of that face. If this face is not planar, the chamfer angle is measured with respect to the tangent plane to the underlying surface at points on the offset curve.
the distance from the modified edge to the end of the chafer on the selected adjacent face.
a BOOLEAN which indicates whether or not the reference face, used to define the angle of the chamfer, is to the left of the chamfered edge.
the angle between the chamfer and the selected face.
The shall be positive.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_depression is a type of
that has depressions in one or more faces. The particular types of depression are modelled in the subtypes. A Solid_with_depression is a , or a , or a , or a, or a .
the position and orientation of the depression modifying the shape of the solid.
the depth of the depression.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_through_depression is a type of
in which the depression penetrates completely through one or more of the faces of the solid.
the set of faces penetrated by the depression.
A Solid_with_stepped_round_hole is a type of
in for which the depression has the shape of a round hole which may be stepped. The shape of the bottom of the hole is defined in the subtypes. A Solid_with_stepped_round_hole may be a
and either a
or a
or a .
the number of cylindrical segments of the hole.
the list of consecutive radii of the cylindrical hole.
the list of depths of the cylindrical components of the depression.
the total depth of the hole, this is the sum of the individual segment depths.
If the is also of type
then the type list shall not include any of the subtypes that define blind bottom conditions for holes of this type.
A Conical_stepped_hole_transition is a type of
is a conical face interposed at a junction between two cylindrical segments of a . The cone is characterized in terms of its apex angle and its base radius. The apex of the cone always lies on the hole axis, on that side of the junction for which the hole radius is smaller, and the base radius of the cone is defined on the planar surface normal to that axis and intersecting it at the point where the radius change occurs. The apex angle is positive when the transition is from a larger to a smaller hole radius, in the sense of increasing hole depth, and negative if it is from a smaller to a larger radius.
the number of the transition defined by the conical shape.
the apex angle of the conical surface defining the transition.
the base radius of the conical transition surface.
The shall be positive.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_stepped_round_hole_and_conical_transitions is a type of
with conical transitions between some of the cylindrical sections of the hole.
the set of conical transitions.
The shall not exceed the number of segments by more than 1.
If the entity is also of type
then the number of transitions shall not exceed the number of segments.
A Solid_with_flat_bottom_hole is a type of
having a flat bottom.
the radius of the fillet between the flat bottom of the hole and its cylindrical shaft.
The shall be less than the radius of the final cylindrical segment of the hole.
The shall not be negative.
A Solid_with_spherical_bottom_hole is a type of
having a spherical bottom.
the radius of the spherical surface at the bottom of the hole.
The shall be greater than the radius of the final cylindrical segment of the hole.
A Solid_with_conical_bottom_hole is a type of
having a conical bottom.
the semi-angle at the apex of the conical surface at the bottom of the hole.
radius of the spherical surface rounding off the tip of the conical surface at the bottom of the hole.
The shall be less than the radius of the final cylindrical segment of the hole.
The shall not be negative but may be zero.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_pocket is a type of
in which the depression is in the form of a pocket. The shape of thepocket is fully defined in the subtypes. A Solid_with_pocket is either a , or a , or a .
the radius of the blend or fillet between the floor and the walls of the pocket.
the draft angle applied to the walls of the pocket.
The shall be positive or zero.
A Solid_with_rectangular_pocket is a type of
in which the depression is in the form of a rectangular pocket.
the length of the pocket.
the width of the pocket.
the radius of the fillet at the corners of the pocket.
The shall be less than the length and less than the width of the pocket.
The shall be positive.
The shall be positive.
The shall be positive or zero.
A Solid_with_circular_pocket is a type of
in which the depression is in the form of a circular pocket.
the radius of the cylinder forming the pocket.
The shall be less than the radius of the cylindrical hole.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_general_pocket is a type of
in which the depression has a user-defined profile.
the shape defining the cross-section of the pocket. This attribute is incompletely specified in the ARM model, it is fully defined in the MIM where it is mapped to a
related to a
or
instance.
a point used to locate the profile of the pocket on the solid.
A Solid_with_slot is a type of
on which a slot has been created. A slot is a depression whose shape is generated by sweeping a constant symmetrical cross-sectional profile along a linear or curved path, and which may have one or two rounded ends generated by rotating half the slot cross-sectional profile about its axis of symmetry. Alternatively, one or both ends of the slot may emerge from the part material. The slot may be either trapeziodal or tee shaped in cross-section. A Solid_with_slot is either a
or a
and either a
or a .
the width of the slot profile.
!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ Schema: Solid_with_local_modification_arm Entity: Solid_with_slot Attribute: closed_ends ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
a list of two logical values indicating whether, or not, the respective ends of the slot are closed.
a list of two sets of faces, defining the entry and exit faces of an open-ended slot at its extremities.
The shall not be of type
if both ends of the slot are declared to be open.
If either end of the slot is closed, the set of end exit faces corresponding to that end of the slot shall be empty.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_straight_slot is a type of
on which a slot has been created by sweeping the slot profile along a straight line.
the length of the slot.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_curved_slot is a type of
on which a slot has been created by sweeping the slot profile along a curve.
the curve defining the centre line of the slot. This attribute is incompletely specified in the ARM model, it is fully defined in the MIM where it is mapped to a
instance.
A Solid_with_trapezoidal_slot is a type of
on which a slot has been created by sweeping a profile of trapezoidal shape.
the draft angle, measured with respect to the plane of symmetry of the slot section. For a positive draft angle the slot walls slope inwards with increasing depth. A negative draft angle gives rise to a slot of dovetail form.
the radius of the fillet at the bottom of the slot, if zero the slot has a flat floor.
The shall be positive or zero.
A Solid_with_tee_slot is a type of
on which a slot has been created by sweeping a profile of tee shape. in which the The slot section has the form of an inverted letter T. Its overall depth (measured in the direction of the axis of symmetry) is defined by the
attribute of the supertype; the width of the leg of the T (measured in the perpendicular direction) is defined by .
the width of the wider section of the tee.
the length of the stem, or narrow part, of the tee section.
The shall be less than the
The shall be greater than .
The shall be positive.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_groove is a type of
that results from the creation of a depression extending around a surface of revolution in such a way that its cross-sections are constant in any plane containing the axis of that surface. The cross-section is of symmetric trapezoidal form, which includes as special cases rectangular sections, sections with draft angles and V-sections.
the radius of the cylindrical floor surface of the groove.
the width of the groove.
!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ Schema: Solid_with_local_modification_arm Entity: Solid_with_groove Attribute: draft_angle ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
the draft angle of the groove.
the radius of the fillet at the corners of the floor of the groove.
a BOOLEAN value which indicates whether the groove is on an external surface of the solid (TRUE), or internal surface (FALSE).
The shall not be of type
The shall be positive.
The shall be positive.
The shall be positive or zero.
A Solid_with_protrusion is a type of
that results from the creation of a protrusion extending above the surface of the solid. The protrusion may be circular, rectangular or have a user-defined cross-section. A Solid_with_protrusion is either a , or a , or a .
the position and orientation of the protrusion.
the height to the top of the protrusion.
the draft angle of the protrusion.
The shall be of positive.
A Solid_with_circular_protrusion is a type of
such that the protrusion has a circular cross-section.
the radius of the circular cross-section of the protrusion.
The shall be positive.
A Solid_with_rectangular_protrusion is a type of
such that the protrusion has a rectangular cross-section.
the length of the rectangular cross-section of the protrusion measured in the direction of the local X axis of .
the width of the rectangular cross-section of the protrusion measured in the direction of the local Y axis of .
the radius of the fillet at the corners of the rectangular cross-section of the protrusion, this may be zero.
The shall be less than half the width and less than half the length of the protrusion.
The shall be of positive.
The shall be of positive.
The shall not be negative but may be zero.
A Solid_with_general_protrusion is a type of
such that the protrusion is a general planar area.
the shape of the cross-section of the protrusion.
This attribute is incompletely specified in the ARM model, it is fully defined in the MIM where it is mapped to an instance of
defining a closed planar area.
a point defining the location of the .
A Solid_with_circular_pattern is a type of
that has a regular circular pattern replicating a previously defined shape modification feature.
the position and orientation of the circular pattern of shape modifications.
the shape modification feature that is replicated to form the circular pattern, this may be a depression, a protrusion or another pattern.
the number of repetitions of the replicated element, excluding the original.
the angular displacement between successive replicates.
a BOOLEAN indicating whether, or not, the replicates are individually rotated about the centre of rotation. If false, each point in the pattern has the same translation as the reference point, so that the orientation of the original configuration is maintained.
a point associated with the original configuration to be replicated, whose projected distance from the axis of rotation determines the radius of the circular pattern. The replicates have corresponding transformed reference points at equal angular spacings about the axis of the circular pattern.
The shall be of positive.
A Solid_with_rectangular_pattern is a type of
that has a regular rectangular pattern replicating a previously defined shape modification feature.
the position and orientation of the circular pattern of shape modifications.
the shape modification feature that is replicated to form the rectangular pattern, this may be a depression, a protrusion or another pattern. The original configuration is in row 1, column 1 of the pattern.
the number of rows in the pattern.
the number of columns in the pattern.
the distance between successive rows of the pattern.
the distance between successive columns of the pattern.
The product of
and shall be of positive.
The shall be of positive.
The shall be of positive.
A Solid_with_incomplete_circular_pattern is a type of
in which some of the replicates have been omitted.
the set of integers giving the index numbers of the omitted replicates in the pattern.
The number of omitted instances shall be less than
No integer identifier in the set of omitted replicates shall have a value that is greater than
A Solid_with_incomplete_rectangular_pattern is a type of
in which some of the replicates have been omitted.
the set of pairs of integers giving the row and column numbers of the omitted replicates in the pattern.
The original modification feature in row 1, column 1 of the pattern shall not be omitted.
The total number of omitted replicates shall be less than the number of instances in the pattern.
The row index of any omitted replicate shall not exceed the row count of the rectangular pattern, and no column index shall exceed the column count.
An Advanced_open_shell is a type of
that is a collection of faces forming an open shell.
the set of faces defining the geometry and topology of the .
An Advanced_closed_shell is a type of
that is a collection of faces forming a closed shell.
the set of faces defining the geometry and topology of the
A Sculptured_solid is a type of
in which a solid is cut by a surface, face or shell to remove part of the material leaving a smaller solid model.
the surface, face, or open shell used to divide the remaining solid from the material removed.
an indicator of the side of the sculpturing element on which the result of the cutting operation is to be retained. If its value is true the solid on the positive side of the surface, face or shell is retained, and vice versa. The definition of the positive side of the sculpturing element depends on the nature of that element. For a , it is the side containing the positive surface normal vector. For a , or an , it is the side containing the topological normal to the face or shell respectively.
A Sculptured_solid_with_selection is a type of
to be used when the simple definition of a
does not give a unique result with two or more remaining solids.
an
which defines the boundary of the solid to be retained.
A Solid_with_offset_faces is a type of
in which some of the faces are offset in the direction of the face normal.
the list of sets of faces which are to be modified.
the list of distances by which the modified faces are offset. The nth. length in this list is applied to the nth. set of faces in the
list. A positive value makes the solid locally larger, a negative value subtracts material in the vicinity of that set of faces.
The number of shall be equal to the number of .
A Deleted_face_solid is a type of
in which some of the faces are removed and the remaining faces are thickened to produce a solid in the form of a thick shell. This operation is sometimes called `shelling', or `hollowing'. A Deleted_face_solid may be a
or a .
the set of faces which are to be removed from the solid.
the thickness of the remaining faces of the modified solid. A positive value indicates that material is to be added in the direction of the face normal, if thickness is negative the added material is below the face.
The shall be non-zero.
A Deleted_face_solid_with_offsets is a type of
for which two thickness offset values are specified to define the thickening of the remaining faces.
the second thickness value to be applied to the retained faces of the base solid. The retained faces will have a thickness equal to the difference between
and thickness2.
The shall be non-zero.
The shall not be equal to
A Complex_deleted_face_solid is a type of
in which selected faces have specified thicknesses differing from the general
inherited from the supertype .
the list of sets of faces having different thickness values.
the list of individual thickness values to be assigned to the faces in
The number of sets of faces in
shall be equal to the size of thickness_list.
The shall no be equal to
The function calculates the total depth of a
by adding together the depths of the individual segments.
(Input) The
for which the total depth of the hole is to be computed.
